Review Text: Quite some history at this temple especially with relation to Lord Murgan. It's on the banks of Manik river and at times it seems like it is in the middle of the river. Usually a first stop before visiting Kataragama

This is holly place for god Walliamma’s people. That god is one of wife of god Katharagama. And that kovil is situated in beautiful place next to the river. And there is Buddhist temple next to that kovil.

Review Title: First temple to visit, as Lord Ganesha is the first god to pray.
Review Text: This temple is open after the morning puja for people to pray and the Iyar is there to carry out individual puja.
Sellakatharagama is few Kilometers away from Kataragama main city. Recommended to visit there and to get a historical, spiritual and cultural experiences.

Sell katharagama has developed well over the past years. this time i have visited about 05 years after and i pleased to find the area is well organized and kept clean. over the years back, the place was too untidy and wasn't pleasant enough. how ever, being a one of the leading religious place, and many travelers are pilgrimages, they used to buy basket of fruits to worships the god. Sella katharagama is cheapest compare to other places. How ever, price of fruit basket is 03 time or more if you are going to buy from katharagama and Kiri Wehera area. i strongly suggest, if you are traveling on your own vehicle, please have the fruits taken before hand and this will help for you to save lot unnecessary expenditure which is not worth enough. also most of the traders around the area are too rude. in case if you want to buy vegetable, you may find that it's much cheaper than the Colombo or sub-herbs. but the vegges are sold in bags full, and only you will have good stuff on the top. the bottom is full of rotten vegetables. be careful in case if you wants to buy vegetables.

A temple very close to the main Kataragama temple dedicated to Lord Ganesh, the god of wisdom. Head coverings and footwear have to be removed. The Pooja we went was in the evening around 6 pm. A beautiful Buddhist temple also on the same premises allows people to worship the devale and the temple

it is a kovil " Ganapathi". & also there is a temple newly build. many kovils & dewala situated here. can learn lot about hindu & local goddess. feeding fish was an amazing experience by the river bank.
Very crowded in weekends can park the vehicle very near to the temple, try the road before the market can drive near the temple.
Another  beautiful  sacred buddhist pilgrimage site in Kataragama. So many places to wotship within the site. Never miss to worship or visit this holy site whenever you visit Kataragama.

This is a holy place situated next to Manik ganga. (river). There are lots of small shops and restaurants. But beware of touts and fake faith healers and what not. The temple above the kovila is a nice place to relax. Day time temperature is high during mid day in this area.

After we parked the car, we walked ton a lane that has lots of shops on each side selling food, drinks, souvenirs etc and then we entered the temple complex. The main temple sits on the banks of a river. The temple is undergoing some maintenance just now and  the "tower" has been repainted gold and white.  As usual there are lots of statues of deities about, but  Ganesh is the most prevalent. We walked inside the "main" temple but could not get into the inner sanctum as it was closed off.
It is a sacred place. You can observe much more activities if you can be there by morning 10. Highly crowded place in the weekend.
This temple is close to Kathirkamam Murugan temple but not sure if you can walk it. It is situated next to a river same as Kathirkamam Murugan temple. It is a must go place for religious people.

Sella kataragama, at a short distance from Kataragama is a beautiful plce. A village with all the basic ingredients of a village. A Ganapathi temple is at the centre , surrounded by the Shrines of Durga Devi, and Shiva on the sides . A small brook flows just behind the Ganapathy temple. Outside the Ganapathy temple on the eastern side we see a flight of stairs leading to a vast area, with many Buddha Vihars and Muruga Temples. As in Kataragama temple , here also there is a screen in front of the sanctum sanatorium, with beautiful figures of the lord. Ample parking place outside the temple. Many shops selling herbs greet the visitors. A visit to this temple must be included in the Srilanka tour.

Another place of worship in the locality and all locals visiting the town makes it a point to visit and offer their worship to this place too. A historical place with lot of stories of how it came to be.

Beleif is that Sella Kataragama has to be visited first before visiting Kataragama. Sella is about 10 minutes drive from Kataragama. The road to Sella from Kataragama is beautiful with trees lined on both sides of the road. If you are travelling by bus then take a bus that goes to Buttala. The Kovil is about 100 meters from the bus stop at Sella. There is small river flowing by the side. The Kovil is open right through the day till 7.30 p.m. If you are not oriented traditionally I suggest that you visit this temple after visiting Kataragama since there the temple closes in the afternoon from 1.30 to 6.15 p.m.Here in Sella the main deity is Lord Ganesha. I missed the Valli amma Kovil since i went there after 12 noon. The banks of the river are a bit unclean.which spoils the beauty of the place.. you can spend 30 minutes to a hour in Sella
This temple is right in the river of manikai Ganga. The temple is small and it is recommended to go here before visiting the katharagama temple
Unlike as in Kataragama, here people coming for their wishes, may be for a exam, for a sickness.. Usually very crowded. But, mind relaxing.
Good place to visit in kataragama. It's very crowded. But still very popular with Hindu and Buddhist population in Sri Lanka.

I was not taking pictures here, becase it was full of people ready for ceremony. It is better to cover your knees and shoulders. You can buy flowers and food at market in front of this temple. There are free walking cows eating trash (flowers and fruit).
This place is near Kataragama. One Buddhist temple and A gana Devi Kovil is there. Manik river is close by
When you visit to Kataragama Temple, you can visit this temple also. This temple got usual Hindu priests for religious activities.

This temple is belongs to the wife of god katharagama as believe by sri lankans and lots of pilgrims visit during ti's season in August every year, they believe this place as on of them's spiritual god's wife's temple
Cleanliness should improve. Too many shoppers and interrupting the religious atmosphere. The authorities should not allow shoppers inside the temple, like in Kataragama.
This is the sister temple of the main Kataragama temple.You can combine both together. The Manik river goes along the temple.

People call this place as "Gage Dewale" also. very beautiful kovil situted close to Manik Gaga. You can also feed fish in the river. This is lord Ganeshas kovil and you will find a temple when you climb up the stares.

This is small temple next to a river. You have to walk 1/2 km to reach the temple, lots of bugs in the temple, if stand for five min you will be surrounded by thousands of bees. We did stay for more than 10 min with kids
Lord Ganesha has settled down here and the prayer times are excellent. I go early to be there in the front to ring the temple bell during puja time
Omm namo Ganesh! God of Ganesh! We are deffnetly visit there when we go kataragama.  Specially get help to the children's.  Who study! Nice locations.  Lot of monkey. Looking frowerd to visit there.

Sella Kataragama is a very important place in Kataragama. About 4 mile from Sella to Kataragama. At the long distance fast a love seen was between Skanda Kumar and Valliamma at here. One mile short tunnel of Sella Kataragma is Valli’s cave. There is a small shrine to Ganesh, which s visited by the pilgrims. There is the place tradition says walliamma met the elephant when she was escorting Kataragma to the well. Sella Kataragma has many Kovils. Those are Ganapathi Kovil, Siva Kovil, Kataragama Kovil, Valliamma Kovil, Lakshmi Kovil and Saman Devalaya
There were lot of devottes were there. I usually attend  10.15 am poojawa. It is too good to go there at that  time. It is in the middle of menik river.

Sella Kataragama is the first place that Lord Kataragama/Muruga ever set foot in Sri Lanka. He came to Sella looking for Goddess "Valli" that became his wife soon after. Sella Kataragama is where they settled and continued their life. The cave is still much alive for the holy worshippers and the foot print of Goddess "Valli" is still to be seen, which is breath taking. Sella kataragama is a must visit to any holy hearted worshipper as it was the beginning of the whole Holiness of the entire area of Kataragama.
A very nice temple which I have visited. Nearby River creates a nice atmosphere. This place is very calm. worth while going and see.

Before we commence our Kathirkamam temple visit, we must get the blessings of Lord Ganesh, so we need to travel 5km northwards to worship a small temple in a village. Adjoining river give us a tantalizing effect and meditation mood automatically.
we visit meny time to sellakataragama sellakataragama is indiya murugan kovi same place,india pepols visit the place,
Is place of devine purity for people on the way to the spiritual growth. One of the most authentic places in Sri Lanka

Very important  place for Hindu peoples.  There's a Hindu kovil.  The story of Rama - Sitha is created surrounded by the sella kataragama. Very quit place, Religious important place in srilanka. 0771177012

it was very old hindu temple. we usually go there whenever we go o kataragama. location is little bit away from main own. you have to drive 10 minutes and then again you have to walk around 500m to 1km to hindu temple.
Religious place. God Ganesh Temple & God Skanda (Katharagama) Temple.memorable visit. Recommend for pure devotees.
This was the place Lord Ganesh & Lord Katharagama Played in their childhood. Now it has been established temples.
Nice place. Near the Ruhunu kataragama Maha devalaya. it's 5km to there. it's also very popular place. I love that Sella Kataragama Temple ####
A less traveled Kovil.  It was quiet with very few devotees during mid week.  There was shade, making it easier on your bare feet to tolerate the sand.

This temple is worshipped by both Hindus & Biuddhists,also Indian nationals  too  visit this temple. The temple has so many legends, if you are interested in the history make sure to get a Guide or guidebook as language can be a problem. Also be appropriately dressed as a mark of respect to Hinduism.

it's always a pleasure to visit this holy shrine where all religions can worship no matter what your religion , I can only explain it as a mystic place of worship .Sella Kataragama is a little away from the main Kataragama and one needs to travel out of the main temple area to reach this shrine, all the same it is a must visit for first timers.

A must see after visiting the main temple in Kataragama. A more compact temple site compared to the open grounds of the main temple. Need to navigate yourself through the vendors who line the walkway down to the temple.
If you visit kataragama, you have to visit this place. it is few kilometers from the town. The river is very dangeres as you get crocodiles in it.

This is a religious place like Kataragama initialy there was a Ganapathy (vinayagar) temple was here now it had been developed and many shrines are there. It is believed that God Murugan met Valli with the help of his brother Ganesh. There is a river by the side of the temple its worth making a visit if you go to Kataragama

A Wonderful Temple on the Banks of Manika ganga. The gurgling sound and sight of the RIVER flowing at the back drop of the temple is undescribable .It s about 8km from Kataragama and you can take tuktuk for 500 to 600 lkr up n down.A must see place for any temple tourist .You have the Lord Ganesh and Muruga together in a sannidhi and there are smaller sannidis for navagraha and anjaneya .There is also a new built temple above and a Buddhist temple too.
